greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, after which, for odd numbers: a(n) = A260739(n)-th number k for which A260738(k) = A260738(n)-1, and for even numbers: a(n) = a(n/2).
comment: For odd numbers n > 1, a(n) tells which term is on the immediately preceding row of A255127 (square array generated by Ludic sieve), in the same column where n itself is.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..33011
formula: a(1) = 1; after which, for even numbers a(n) = a(n/2), and for odd numbers a(n) = A255127(A260738(n)-1, A260739(n)).
xref: Cf. A269172, A269355, A269357, A269382, A269386, A269388 (sequences that use this function).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2016
